Current Mental Status Examination: General appearance & behavior: NAD ; Speech: Confused, Mood & Affect: Anxious, Thought: Negative, Perception: Distorted, Cognitive functions: Disturbed, Judgement and Insight: Poor and intact.
Psychotherapy Technique: Thought Challenging/ Cognitive restructuring/ Problem solving
Issues discussed in Current Session:
Themes discussed in the session:
1) Anxiety: Patient feels stressed because of her full-time job, part-time studies, and impending wedding preparations. Difficult for her to take responsibility and cope with the situation effectively.

2) Fear of Failure: Failing an important exam has triggered feelings of inadequacy and self-doubt in Marsha. She feels like she's let herself and her family down, and this fear of failure has become a significant barrier to her academic pursuits.

3) Perfectionism:  Patient has the need to be successful in all aspects of her life which makes her feel disappointed. 

4) Negative perception: Patient feels not good enough, low self-esteem and worthlessness. 

5) Technique used: Counselor used the ABC model of CBT to help her identify and challenge her faulty beliefs.
